content:
Hi, Why is it that in https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wasm-tools/blob/fac9fb5065c9d4b3adc057fc83df67f49cf1687f/crates/wit-parser/src/ast/resolve.rs#L633-L638 all the world types are added to imports and none to exports? E.g. for this wit https://github.com/bytecodealliance/wit-bindgen/blob/main/tests/codegen/same-names5.wit isn't it important that as records can contain resources, that the usage of the record as an import or export is defined? From the code it can't be important but I don't understand why as I thought the implementation of a resource was different depending on whether it was used as an import or export?

wasm-tools/crates/wit-parser/src/ast/resolve.rs at fac9fb5065c9d4b3adc057fc83df67f49cf1687f 路 bytecodealliance/wasm-tools
CLI and Rust libraries for low-level manipulation of WebAssembly modules - bytecodealliance/wasm-tools
wit-bindgen/tests/codegen/same-names5.wit at main 路 bytecodealliance/wit-bindgen
A language binding generator for WebAssembly interface types - bytecodealliance/wit-bindgen
